 <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furl.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com%2Fs%2FqgmBCO5ABUpWN6quEfPIGNUHK%3Fdomain%3Dmmc.zoom.us&data=05%7C02%7Chagop.ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7Cb892af01f3c14e81327108dd1466478c%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638689151728801235%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=y7QdBZIeR2lYRejYHuZ6Mwye85kG5TN6tW%2BgYyPXUdk%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 

 

 

We are excited to invite you to our upcoming webinar "Storm Risk in the Middle East: Lessons learned from the UAE, insurance implications and how to build resilience.” This insightful session will delve into the key challenges posed by the extreme weather events experienced in the GCC in 2024, address climate risks and their implications for organizations across the region.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: Tuesday, 10 December, 2024

Time: 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM (GST)

Location: Zoom Webinar 

	

In this insightful session, we will discuss:

chunks.text:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: Tuesday, 10 December, 2024

Time: 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM (GST)

Location: Zoom Webinar 

	

In this insightful session, we will discuss:

*	An overview of the 2024 extreme weather events and climate risks in the GCC.
*	A summary of the claims and types of claims that we have seen specifically in the UAE.
*	The implications of these events on insurance programs and renewals.
*	Strategies for building resilience to extreme weather events.
*	A client case study outlining real experiences.
*	An opportunity to ask our panel of experts any questions you may have. 

This webinar emphasizes the importance of proactively addressing climate risks and building resilience to minimize future impacts. By attending, you will gain valuable knowledge and insights to better navigate the changing landscape of storm risk in the region.

Please register for the webinar by clicking the link below.

We hope you will join us for what promises to be an informative and engaging session.
